The quadratic extended-real function associated to a linear map Unknown identifier `Q`Q on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n, . Here the inner product is written as the dot product on coordinates .

noncomputable def quadraticHalfLinear (n : Nat) (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) : (Fin n Real) EReal := fun x => (((1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) : Real) : EReal)

A function Unknown identifier `f`f on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n is symmetric with respect to a set Unknown identifier `G`G of orthogonal linear transformations if it is invariant under every element of Unknown identifier `G`G, i.e. Unknown identifier `f`sorry = sorry : Propf (g x) = Unknown identifier `f`f x for all Unknown identifier `g`sorry sorry : Propg Unknown identifier `G`G and all Unknown identifier `x`x.

def IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet { : Type*} (n : Nat) (G : Set ((Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real))) (f : (Fin n Real) ) : Prop := g G, x : Fin n Real, f (g x) = f x

If Unknown identifier `g`g preserves dot products, then Unknown identifier `g.symm`g.symm is the adjoint of Unknown identifier `g`g for the dot product.

lemma dotProduct_orthogonal_symm_apply {n : Nat} (g : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hg : x y : Fin n Real, (g x) (g y) = x y) : x y : Fin n Real, (g x) y = x (g.symm y) := by intro x y simpa using (hg x (g.symm y))

The Fenchel conjugate commutes with precomposition by an "orthogonal" map (for the dot product), with the inverse appearing on the dual side.

lemma fenchelConjugate_precomp_orthogonal (n : Nat) (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) (g : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hAStar : x y : Fin n Real, (g x) y = x (g.symm y)) : fenchelConjugate n (fun x => f (g x)) = fun xStar => fenchelConjugate n f (g xStar) := by classical -- Theorem 12.3 with `h = f`, `a = 0`, `aStar = 0`, ` = 0`, and `AStar = g.symm`. simpa [sub_eq_add_neg, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] using (fenchelConjugate_affineTransform (n := n) (h := f) (A := g.toLinearEquiv) (AStar := g.symm.toLinearEquiv) (hAStar := hAStar) (a := 0) (aStar := 0) ( := 0))

A lower semicontinuous convex function that never takes the value equals its Fenchel biconjugate.

lemma fenchelConjugate_biconjugate_eq_of_closedConvex (n : Nat) (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) (hf_closed : LowerSemicontinuous f) (hf_convex : ConvexFunction f) (hf_ne_bot : x : Fin n Real, f x ( : EReal)) : fenchelConjugate n (fenchelConjugate n f) = f := by classical by_cases hall_top : x : Fin n Real, f x = ( : EReal) have hf : f = constPosInf n := by funext x simp [constPosInf, hall_top x] simp [hf, fenchelConjugate_constPosInf, fenchelConjugate_constNegInf] have hx : x : Fin n Real, f x ( : EReal) := by simpa [not_forall] using hall_top rcases hx with x0, hx0 have hx0_ne_bot : f x0 ( : EReal) := hf_ne_bot x0 have hcoe : ((f x0).toReal : EReal) = f x0 := EReal.coe_toReal (x := f x0) hx0 hx0_ne_bot have hne_epi : Set.Nonempty (epigraph (S := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real))) f) := by refine (x0, (f x0).toReal), ?_ refine by trivial, ?_ -- `f x0` is a real value, hence below its `toReal` coercion. simp [hcoe] have hf_proper : ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) f := by refine ?_, hne_epi, ?_ simpa [ConvexFunction] using hf_convex intro x hx simpa using hf_ne_bot x have hbiconj : fenchelConjugate n (fenchelConjugate n f) = clConv n f := fenchelConjugate_biconjugate_eq_clConv (n := n) (f := f) have hcl : clConv n f = f := clConv_eq_of_closedProperConvex (n := n) (f := f) (hf_closed := hf_closed) (hf_proper := hf_proper) simp [hbiconj, hcl]

If Unknown identifier `f`f is invariant under a set Unknown identifier `G`G of dot-product-orthogonal maps, then its Fenchel conjugate is invariant under Unknown identifier `G`G.

lemma isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet_fenchelConjugate_of_isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet (n : Nat) (G : Set ((Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real))) (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) (hG : g G, x y : Fin n Real, (g x) (g y) = x y) : IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet n G f IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet n G (fenchelConjugate n f) := by intro hfG g hg xStar have hAStar : x y : Fin n Real, (g x) y = x (g.symm y) := dotProduct_orthogonal_symm_apply (g := g) (hg := hG g hg) have hconj := fenchelConjugate_precomp_orthogonal (n := n) (f := f) (g := g) (hAStar := hAStar) have hpre : (fun x : Fin n Real => f (g x)) = f := by funext x exact hfG g hg x have hconj_apply := congrArg (fun F => F xStar) hconj -- Rewrite `(f g)^*` using Theorem 12.3 and then use `f g = f`. simpa [hpre] using hconj_apply.symm

Corollary 12.3.1. A closed convex function Unknown identifier `f`f is symmetric with respect to a given set Unknown identifier `G`G of orthogonal linear transformations if and only if is symmetric with respect to Unknown identifier `G`G.

theorem isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet_iff_isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet_fenchelConjugate (n : Nat) (G : Set ((Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real))) (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) (hf_closed : LowerSemicontinuous f) (hf_convex : ConvexFunction f) (hf_ne_bot : x : Fin n Real, f x ( : EReal)) (hG : g G, x y : Fin n Real, (g x) (g y) = x y) : IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet n G f IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet n G (fenchelConjugate n f) := by constructor intro hfG exact isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet_fenchelConjugate_of_isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet (n := n) (G := G) (f := f) (hG := hG) hfG intro hfStarG have hfBiG : IsSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet n G (fenchelConjugate n (fenchelConjugate n f)) := isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet_fenchelConjugate_of_isSymmetricWrtOrthogonalSet (n := n) (G := G) (f := fenchelConjugate n f) (hG := hG) hfStarG have hbiconj : fenchelConjugate n (fenchelConjugate n f) = f := fenchelConjugate_biconjugate_eq_of_closedConvex (n := n) (f := f) (hf_closed := hf_closed) (hf_convex := hf_convex) (hf_ne_bot := hf_ne_bot) simpa [hbiconj] using hfBiG

If Unknown identifier `P_L`P_L acts as the identity on Unknown identifier `L`L and Unknown identifier `Q`sorry sorry = sorry : PropQ Unknown identifier `Q'`Q' = Unknown identifier `P_L`P_L, then Unknown identifier `Q`sorry = sorry : PropQ (Q' xStar) = Unknown identifier `xStar`xStar on Unknown identifier `L`L.

lemma Q_Q'_apply_eq_of_mem_L {n : Nat} (Q Q' P_L : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (L : Submodule (Fin n Real)) (hQQ' : Q.comp Q' = P_L) (hP_L_id : xStar : Fin n Real, xStar L P_L xStar = xStar) {xStar : Fin n Real} (hxStar : xStar L) : Q (Q' xStar) = xStar := by have hcomp : Q (Q' xStar) = P_L xStar := by simpa [LinearMap.comp_apply] using congrArg (fun T => T xStar) hQQ' simpa [hP_L_id xStar hxStar] using hcomp

lemma range_term_quadraticHalfLinear_le_on_L {n : Nat} (Q Q' P_L : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (L : Submodule (Fin n Real)) (hQQ' : Q.comp Q' = P_L) (hP_L_id : xStar : Fin n Real, xStar L P_L xStar = xStar) (hQsymm : x y : Fin n Real, (Q x) y = x Q y) (hQpsd : x : Fin n Real, 0 x Q x) {xStar : Fin n Real} (hxStar : xStar L) : x : Fin n Real, ((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfLinear n Q x quadraticHalfLinear n Q' xStar := by classical intro x set q : Fin n Real := Q' xStar have hQq : Q q = xStar := by simpa [q] using Q_Q'_apply_eq_of_mem_L (Q := Q) (Q' := Q') (P_L := P_L) (L := L) hQQ' hP_L_id hxStar have hpsd : 0 (x - q) Q (x - q) := hQpsd (x - q) have hqx : (q Q x : Real) = (x Q q : Real) := by calc (q Q x : Real) = (Q x q : Real) := by simp [dotProduct_comm] _ = (x Q q : Real) := by simpa using (hQsymm x q) have hEq : (x - q) Q (x - q) = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x xStar : Real) + (xStar q : Real) := by calc (x - q) Q (x - q) = (x Q x : Real) - (x Q q : Real) - (q Q x : Real) + (q Q q : Real) := by simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_dotProduct, dotProduct_add, map_add, map_neg, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm] _ = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x Q q : Real) + (q Q q : Real) := by nlinarith [hqx] _ = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x xStar : Real) + (xStar q : Real) := by simp [hQq, dotProduct_comm] have hreal : (x xStar : Real) - (1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) (1 / 2 : Real) * (xStar q) := by have h0 : 0 (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x xStar : Real) + (xStar q : Real) := by have h0' := hpsd rw [hEq] at h0' exact h0' have : 2 * (x xStar : Real) (x Q x : Real) + (xStar q : Real) := by nlinarith linarith [h0] have hE : (((x xStar : Real) - (1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) : Real) : EReal) (((1 / 2 : Real) * (xStar q) : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast hreal simpa [quadraticHalfLinear, q, EReal.coe_sub, EReal.coe_mul, sub_eq_add_neg, mul_assoc, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm] using hE

Text 12.3.2: Let Unknown identifier `Q`Q be a symmetric positive semi-definite Unknown identifier `n`sorry sorry : Type (max u_1 u_2)n Unknown identifier `n`n matrix and consider the quadratic convex function . (If Unknown identifier `Q`Q is nonsingular, then Unknown identifier `L`sorry = ^ sorry : PropL = ^Unknown identifier `n`n and Unknown identifier `Q'`sorry = sorry : PropQ' = Unknown identifier `Q`Q.)

theorem fenchelConjugate_quadraticHalfLinear_pseudoinverse (n : Nat) (Q Q' P_L : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (L : Submodule (Fin n Real)) (hL : L = LinearMap.range Q) (hQQ' : Q.comp Q' = P_L) (_hQ'Q : Q'.comp Q = P_L) (hP_L_id : xStar : Fin n Real, xStar L P_L xStar = xStar) (hQsymm : x y : Fin n Real, (Q x) y = x Q y) (hQpsd : x : Fin n Real, 0 x Q x) : fenchelConjugate n (quadraticHalfLinear n Q) = (by classical exact fun xStar => if xStar L then quadraticHalfLinear n Q' xStar else ( : EReal)) := by classical ext xStar unfold fenchelConjugate by_cases hxStar : xStar L -- On `L`, complete the square to get the exact value. rw [if_pos hxStar] refine le_antisymm ?_ ?_ -- Upper bound by the completed-square inequality. refine sSup_le ?_ rintro y x, rfl exact range_term_quadraticHalfLinear_le_on_L (Q := Q) (Q' := Q') (P_L := P_L) (L := L) hQQ' hP_L_id hQsymm hQpsd hxStar x -- Lower bound: evaluate the supremum at `x = Q' xStar`. have hxQq : Q (Q' xStar) = xStar := by simpa using Q_Q'_apply_eq_of_mem_L (Q := Q) (Q' := Q') (P_L := P_L) (L := L) hQQ' hP_L_id hxStar have hle : (((Q' xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfLinear n Q (Q' xStar)) sSup (Set.range fun x : Fin n Real => ((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfLinear n Q x) := le_sSup Q' xStar, rfl have hterm : ((Q' xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - quadraticHalfLinear n Q (Q' xStar) = quadraticHalfLinear n Q' xStar := by -- `Q' x*, x* - (1/2)Q' x*, Q(Q' x*) = (1/2)x*, Q' x*`. set a : Real := (Q' xStar xStar : Real) have ha : a - (1 / 2 : Real) * a = (1 / 2 : Real) * a := by ring calc ((Q' xStar xStar : Real) : EReal) - (1 / 2 : Real) * a : Real) : EReal) := by exact (EReal.coe_sub a ((1 / 2 : Real) * a)).symm _ = (((1 / 2 : Real) * a : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast ha _ = quadraticHalfLinear n Q' xStar := by simp [quadraticHalfLinear, a, dotProduct_comm] simpa [hterm] using hle -- Off `L`, the range term is unbounded above. rw [if_neg hxStar] -- Reduce to showing the supremum is `` by real upper bounds. refine EReal.eq_of_forall_le_coe_iff (a := _) (b := ( : EReal)) (fun => ?_) constructor intro hle -- Construct a linear functional vanishing on `L` but sending `xStar` to `1`, -- then represent it as a dot product with a vector `v`. rcases LinearMap.exists_extend_of_notMem (p := L) (v := xStar) (f := (0 : L [] Real)) hxStar (1 : Real) with g, hgL, hgxStar rcases linearMap_exists_dotProduct_representation (n := n) g with v, hv have hxStar_v : xStar v = 1 := by simpa [hv] using hgxStar have hQx_v : x : Fin n Real, (Q x) v = 0 := by intro x have hxmem : Q x L := by -- `Q x range Q = L`. rw [hL] exact x, rfl have : g (Q x) = 0 := by have := congrArg (fun T : L [] Real => T Q x, hxmem) hgL simpa using this simpa [hv] using this have hQv : Q v = 0 := by -- From symmetry, ` x, x Q v = 0`; take `x = Q v`. have hforall : x : Fin n Real, x Q v = 0 := by intro x have hx : (Q x) v = x Q v := by simpa using (hQsymm x v) simpa [hx] using hQx_v x have : (Q v) (Q v) = 0 := by simpa using hforall (Q v) exact (dotProduct_self_eq_zero).1 this -- Evaluate the range term at `x = ( + 1) v`. set x : Fin n Real := ( + 1) v have hx_term : ((x xStar : Real) : EReal) - Text 12.3.3: A proper convex function Unknown identifier `f`f on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n is a partial quadratic convex function if it can be written as , where Unknown identifier `q`q is a finite quadratic convex function and Unknown identifier `M`M is an affine set. Moreover, Unknown identifier `f`f is partial quadratic iff, after an affine change of coordinates, it has the form , where Unknown identifier `h`h is an elementary partial quadratic convex function, Unknown identifier `A`A is a bijective linear map, and , failed to synthesize Membership ?m.1 Type Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.Unknown identifier `` .

def IsPartialQuadraticConvexFunction (n : Nat) (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) : Prop := ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) f (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (b : Fin n Real) (c : Real) (M : AffineSubspace (Fin n Real)), ( x : Fin n Real, 0 x Q x) f = fun x => quadraticHalfLinear n Q x + ((x b : Real) : EReal) + (c : EReal) + indicatorFunction (M : Set (Fin n Real)) x

Text 12.3.3 (elementary model): An elementary partial quadratic convex function is a prototype partial quadratic convex function given by a diagonal quadratic form plus the indicator of a linear subspace.

def IsElementaryPartialQuadraticConvexFunction (n : Nat) (h : (Fin n Real) EReal) : Prop := (d : Fin n Real) (L : Submodule (Fin n Real)), ( i : Fin n, 0 d i) h = fun x => (((1 / 2 : Real) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (x i) ^ 2) : Real) : EReal) + indicatorFunction (L : Set (Fin n Real)) x

If a proper convex function can be written as , then the affine subspace Unknown identifier `M`M must be nonempty. This is extracted by taking a point in the (nonempty) epigraph of Unknown identifier `f`f and observing that off Unknown identifier `M`M the indicator term forces Unknown identifier `f`sorry = : Propf = .

lemma exists_mem_affineSubspace_of_proper_of_eq_indicator {n : Nat} {f r : (Fin n Real) EReal} {M : AffineSubspace (Fin n Real)} (hfprop : ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) f) (hr_ne_bot : x : Fin n Real, r x ( : EReal)) (hfEq : f = fun x => r x + indicatorFunction (M : Set (Fin n Real)) x) : a : Fin n Real, a M := by classical rcases hfprop.2.1 with p, hp have hp' : (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) p.1 f p.1 (p.2 : EReal) := by simpa [epigraph] using hp have hle : f p.1 (p.2 : EReal) := hp'.2 by_cases hpM : p.1 (M : Set (Fin n Real)) exact p.1, hpM have hfTop : f p.1 = ( : EReal) := by calc f p.1 = r p.1 + indicatorFunction (M : Set (Fin n Real)) p.1 := by simp [hfEq] _ = r p.1 + ( : EReal) := by simp [indicatorFunction, hpM] _ = ( : EReal) := by simpa using (EReal.add_top_of_ne_bot (hr_ne_bot p.1)) have : ( : EReal) (p.2 : EReal) := by have hle' := hle rw [hfTop] at hle' exact hle' exact (not_top_le_coe p.2 this).elim

Convert dot products on Fin sorry : TypeFin Unknown identifier `n`n into inner products on EuclideanSpace (Fin sorry) : TypeEuclideanSpace (Fin Unknown identifier `n`n) via EuclideanSpace.equiv.{u_1, u_3} ( : Type u_1) ( : Type u_3) [RCLike ] : EuclideanSpace L[] EuclideanSpace.equiv. This is the bridge that allows the use of spectral-theorem APIs.

lemma dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n : Nat) (x y : Fin n Real) : (x y : Real) = inner ((EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) ).symm x) ((EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) ).symm y) := by classical -- Use `EuclideanSpace.inner_eq_star_dotProduct` and simplify via the `equiv`/`symm` relation. -- Note: for ``, `star` is the identity. have : inner ((EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) ).symm x) ((EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) ).symm y) = (y x : Real) := by simp [EuclideanSpace.inner_eq_star_dotProduct, dotProduct_comm] simpa [dotProduct_comm] using this.symm

Replace a linear map by its dot-product symmetric part without changing the associated quadratic form . This is implemented by transporting to EuclideanSpace.{u_7, u_8} ( : Type u_7) (n : Type u_8) : Type (max u_7 u_8)EuclideanSpace and symmetrizing using the adjoint.

lemma linearMap_symmPart_dotProduct_preserves_quadratic {n : Nat} (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) : Qs : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real), ( x y : Fin n Real, (Qs x) y = x Qs y) x : Fin n Real, (x Qs x : Real) = (x Q x : Real) := by classical let eL : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) L[] (Fin n Real) := EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) let Qe : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := eL.symm.toLinearMap Q eL.toLinearMap let Qse : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := ((1 / 2 : Real) (Qe + LinearMap.adjoint Qe)) let Qs : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real) := eL.toLinearMap Qse eL.symm.toLinearMap refine Qs, ?_, ?_ intro x y have hQse_symm : u v : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), inner (Qse u) v = inner u (Qse v) := by intro u v have hleft : inner ((LinearMap.adjoint Qe) u) v = inner u (Qe v) := by simpa using (LinearMap.adjoint_inner_left (A := Qe) (x := v) (y := u)) have hright : inner u ((LinearMap.adjoint Qe) v) = inner (Qe u) v := by simpa using (LinearMap.adjoint_inner_right (A := Qe) (x := u) (y := v)) -- Expand both sides, then use the defining properties of the adjoint. simp [Qse, inner_add_left, inner_smul_left, inner_add_right, inner_smul_right, hleft, hright, add_comm] -- Translate dot products into `EuclideanSpace` inner products and use symmetry of `Qse`. -- Start by rewriting dot products via `dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace`. rw [dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := Qs x) (y := y)] rw [dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := x) (y := Qs y)] -- Normalize the bridge maps back to `eL.symm` (Lean may display these as `WithLp.toLp`). change inner (eL.symm (Qs x)) (eL.symm y) = inner (eL.symm x) (eL.symm (Qs y)) -- Cancel the `EuclideanSpace.equiv`/`symm` bridges. have hcancel1 : eL.symm (Qs x) = Qse (eL.symm x) := by simp [Qs, LinearMap.comp_apply] have hcancel2 : eL.symm (Qs y) = Qse (eL.symm y) := by simp [Qs, LinearMap.comp_apply] simpa [hcancel1, hcancel2] using hQse_symm (eL.symm x) (eL.symm y) intro x -- Reduce to the corresponding statement on `EuclideanSpace`. have hx : (x Qs x : Real) = inner (eL.symm x) (eL.symm (Qs x)) := by simpa using dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := x) (y := Qs x) have hxQ : (x Q x : Real) = inner (eL.symm x) (eL.symm (Q x)) := by simpa using dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := x) (y := Q x) have hcancel : eL.symm (Qs x) = Qse (eL.symm x) := by simp [Qs, LinearMap.comp_apply] have hQcancel : eL.symm (Q x) = Qe (eL.symm x) := by simp [Qe, LinearMap.comp_apply] -- Show `inner u (Qse u) = inner u (Qe u)` for `u = eL.symm x`. have hquad : inner (eL.symm x) (Qse (eL.symm x)) = inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) := by have hadj : inner (eL.symm x) ((LinearMap.adjoint Qe) (eL.symm x)) = inner (Qe (eL.symm x)) (eL.symm x) := by simpa using (LinearMap.adjoint_inner_right (A := Qe) (x := eL.symm x) (y := eL.symm x)) calc inner (eL.symm x) (Qse (eL.symm x)) = inner (eL.symm x) (((1 / 2 : Real) (Qe + LinearMap.adjoint Qe)) (eL.symm x)) := by simp [Qse] _ = (1 / 2 : Real) * (inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) + inner (eL.symm x) ((LinearMap.adjoint Qe) (eL.symm x))) := by simp [LinearMap.add_apply, inner_add_right, inner_smul_right, mul_add] _ = (1 / 2 : Real) * (inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) + inner (Qe (eL.symm x)) (eL.symm x)) := by simp [hadj] _ = (1 / 2 : Real) * (inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) + inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x))) := by simp [real_inner_comm] _ = inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) := by ring -- Translate back to dot products. simpa [hx, hxQ, hcancel, hQcancel] using hquad

Transporting an indicator function along a linear equivalence using Submodule.comap.{u_1, u_3, u_5, u_7, u_9} {R : Type u_1} {R : Type u_3} {M : Type u_5} {M : Type u_7} [Semiring R] [Semiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [Module R M] { : R +* R} {F : Type u_9} [FunLike F M M] [SemilinearMapClass F M M] (f : F) (p : Submodule R M) : Submodule R MSubmodule.comap.

Translation identity for the quadratic term when Unknown identifier `Q`Q is symmetric with respect to the dot product. This is the algebraic step used to rewrite a quadratic form in Unknown identifier `x`x in terms of Unknown identifier `x`sorry - sorry : ?m.5x-Unknown identifier `a`a, plus a linear term and a constant.

lemma quadraticHalfLinear_translate_of_dotProduct_symmetric {n : Nat} (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hQsymm : x y : Fin n Real, (Q x) y = x Q y) : a x : Fin n Real, quadraticHalfLinear n Q x = quadraticHalfLinear n Q (x - a) + ((x Q a : Real) : EReal) + (((-(1 / 2 : Real)) * (a Q a) : Real) : EReal) := by classical intro a x -- Work in `Real`, then coerce to `EReal`. have hax : (a Q x : Real) = (x Q a : Real) := by calc (a Q x : Real) = (Q x a : Real) := by simp [dotProduct_comm] _ = (x Q a : Real) := by simpa using (hQsymm x a) have h_expand : (x - a) Q (x - a) = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x Q a : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by calc (x - a) Q (x - a) = (x Q x : Real) - (x Q a : Real) - (a Q x : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_dotProduct, dotProduct_add, map_add, map_neg, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm] _ = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x Q a : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by nlinarith [hax] have hreal : (1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x : Real) = (1 / 2 : Real) * ((x - a) Q (x - a) : Real) + (x Q a : Real) + (-(1 / 2 : Real)) * (a Q a : Real) := by -- Substitute the expansion and simplify. rw [h_expand] ring -- Coerce the real identity into `EReal` and rewrite `quadraticHalfLinear`. have hE : (((1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) : Real) : EReal) = (((1 / 2 : Real) * ((x - a) Q (x - a)) : Real) : EReal) + ((x Q a : Real) : EReal) + (((-(1 / 2 : Real)) * (a Q a) : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast hreal -- Finish by unfolding `quadraticHalfLinear`. simpa [quadraticHalfLinear, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] using hE

Diagonalize a dot-product symmetric positive semidefinite linear operator on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n by transporting to EuclideanSpace.{u_7, u_8} ( : Type u_7) (n : Type u_8) : Type (max u_7 u_8)EuclideanSpace and applying the spectral theorem.

lemma exists_linearEquiv_diagonalize_psd_dotProduct {n : Nat} (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hQsymm : x y : Fin n Real, (Q x) y = x Q y) (hpsd : x : Fin n Real, 0 x Q x) : (A : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (d : Fin n Real), ( i : Fin n, 0 d i) x : Fin n Real, (x Q x : Real) = i, d i * (A x i) ^ 2 := by classical let eL : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) L[] (Fin n Real) := EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) let e : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] (Fin n Real) := eL.toLinearEquiv let Qe : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := e.symm.toLinearMap Q e.toLinearMap have hQe_symm : LinearMap.IsSymmetric Qe := by -- Convert to dot products via `dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace` and apply `hQsymm`. intro u v have hu : inner (Qe u) v = (Q (e u) e v : Real) := by -- `inner (Qe u) v = ` of the corresponding vectors in `Fin n `. have := (dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := Q (e u)) (y := e v)).symm simpa [Qe, eL, e, LinearMap.comp_apply] using this have hv : inner u (Qe v) = (e u Q (e v) : Real) := by have := (dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := e u) (y := Q (e v))).symm simpa [Qe, eL, e, LinearMap.comp_apply] using this -- Now use dot-product symmetry of `Q`. simpa [hu, hv] using congrArg (fun r : Real => r) (hQsymm (e u) (e v)) have hpsdE : u : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), 0 inner u (Qe u) := by intro u have hu : inner u (Qe u) = (e u Q (e u) : Real) := by have := (dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := e u) (y := Q (e u))).symm simpa [Qe, eL, e, LinearMap.comp_apply] using this simpa [hu, dotProduct_comm] using hpsd (e u) have hn : Module.finrank (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) = n := by simp let b : OrthonormalBasis (Fin n) (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) := hQe_symm.eigenvectorBasis (n := n) hn let d : Fin n Real := fun i => hQe_symm.eigenvalues hn i have hd_nonneg : i : Fin n, 0 d i := by intro i have hpos := hpsdE (b i) have hb : inner (b i) (Qe (b i)) = d i := by have hTb : Qe (b i) = (d i) b i := by dsimp [b, d] exact hQe_symm.apply_eigenvectorBasis (hn := hn) (i := i) -- `b i, d i b i = d i`. simp [hTb, d, b, inner_smul_right] simpa [hb] using hpos -- Define the linear equivalence giving eigen-coordinates on `Fin n `. let A : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real) := (eL.symm.toLinearEquiv.trans (b.repr.toLinearEquiv)).trans e refine A, d, hd_nonneg, ?_ intro x -- Convert the dot product into an inner product on `EuclideanSpace`. have hxInner : (x Q x : Real) = inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) := by have := dotProduct_eq_inner_euclideanSpace (n := n) (x := x) (y := Q x) -- `eL.symm (Q x) = Qe (eL.symm x)`. simpa [Qe, eL, e, LinearMap.comp_apply] using this -- Expand the quadratic form in the eigenbasis coordinates. have hdiag : inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) = i : Fin n, d i * (A x i) ^ 2 := by -- Express `u, Qe u` in the orthonormal eigenbasis coordinates. set u : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := eL.symm x have hsum : inner u (Qe u) = i : Fin n, (b.repr u i) * (b.repr (Qe u) i) := by -- Parseval in an orthonormal basis, rewritten using `repr`. simpa [OrthonormalBasis.repr_apply_apply, real_inner_comm, u] using (OrthonormalBasis.sum_inner_mul_inner (b := b) (x := u) (y := Qe u)).symm have hscale : i : Fin n, b.repr (Qe u) i = d i * b.repr u i := by intro i have := hQe_symm.eigenvectorBasis_apply_self_apply (hn := hn) (v := u) (i := i) -- This lemma is stated for `hQe_symm.eigenvectorBasis hn`, which is `b`. simpa [b, d, u, mul_assoc, mul_left_comm, mul_comm] using this have hAcoord : i : Fin n, b.repr u i = A x i := by intro i simp [A, u, eL, e] calc inner (eL.symm x) (Qe (eL.symm x)) = i : Fin n, (b.repr u i) * (b.repr (Qe u) i) := by simpa [u] using hsum _ = i : Fin n, d i * (b.repr u i) ^ 2 := by refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro i hi simp [hscale i, pow_two, mul_assoc, mul_comm] _ = i : Fin n, d i * (A x i) ^ 2 := by refine Finset.sum_congr rfl ?_ intro i hi simp [hAcoord i] -- Finish. simpa [hxInner] using hdiag
